name: Ben
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We had a great time. We spent most of our time in Madrid during the day and lounging around the dome and deck in the evenings. The Origami in the Garden art exhibit is only minutes from the dome (google it if interested). It opened for the first time this year on our last day, but we did not know it closes at 1pm and missed it. We will be back to check it out. Back to the dome... It had everything we needed. Comfortable bed, little fridge, coffee maker, microwave, the basics... The new deck is a HUGE plus. Very nice. We spent all of our evenings on the deck drinking wine, watching the sunset, talking, and taking pictures. This is the time of year where things start to warming up. During the day the dome was getting very warm, but we spent our days exploring so it was not a big deal. Nights are cool year round so that won't be a problem. I am sure the AC will be available soon just like the guest instructions mention. Trey was very accommodating. I would recommend.

name: Heather
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: The dome was nothing short of magical - tastefully decorated, clean, and not to mention the absolutely breathtaking surroundings. We felt secluded and in our own corner of the desert which felt so surreal. I chose to spend my birthday weekend here and could not have made a better choice! Trey was incredibly kind via messaging and we had everything we could ever need. While the dome does change temperatures throughout the day/depending on weather, we followed Trey’s instructions to close the curtains during the day (when sunny) and had no problem maintaining a comfortable temperature inside at all times. I would come back in a heartbeat and can’t wait to plan my next visit - if you have any doubts booking just do it!! This was hands down one of my best Airbnb experiences of all time. Overall we left our weekend at the dome feeling refreshed and inspired - it was truly a beautiful experience!

name: Ryan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
This dome was amazing, and even better than imagined. As the owners make clear, it is essentially a luxury tent, but it was windy and snowy out, around 30 at night, and we were quite cozy inside, especially under blankets. Can't personally speak to air cooling capabilities, but I would trust the owners descriptions. They are up front, and accurate with what to expect (and what not to), and they seemed to think of everything you might need here to be comfortable.
My wife and got here close to 10pm at night after a long day of driving, and were expecting to be cold and huddle under the blanket, but we were pleasantly surprised to find the heater on, and the place was extremely comfortable (high 60ish), and extremely cozy without feeling cramped at all.
Also, on our 5 day road trip, this was the only bidet we encountered which was extremely welcome!
10/10, would stay again.

name: Momo
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
We were woken up at 7:30am loud construction on their property right behind the dome. Their listed quiet hours for guests is til 9am. The construction went on until 5pm. When I reached out, they ignored me and I had to go through Airbnb Support. It seems like they are in the middle of renovating their home, so if you are looking to book the dome soon, you might run into this issue. Private rooms on a host’s property can come with a reasonable amount of noise, however this was deceptive of the host to not inform us about construction from sunrise to sundown.
Very disappointing for the price, but we made the best of our time there and the dome itself is great. I would not recommend this listing for friends staying in Santa Fe and I personally regret giving them my business. Book at your own risk!

·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: This stay in Santa Fe is one of 3 major highlights of my long 6 week roadtrip adventure. The dome is magical. The stargazing is incredible and to be 360 degrees surrounded by beautiful mountains and hills, watching the clouds move and mists settle, rise and roll back across the vast landscape is something very special. The energy in this place is other-worldly good. Trey is a great host! Went out of his way to make my time easy and stress-free, quickly responded with helpful info when asked, and overall just very pleasant to communication. The bed is comfy, shower is great, WC perfectly convenient and nicely done - especially when you realize your really camping in a dome, and little kitchen has all you need for a basic quick snack or sip. I love this spot and loved my two nights in the dome. I would love to return!

review_text:
Quick but great stay. The hosts were very accommodating of our last minute booking. The check in instructions were very clear and easy to follow. The location was remote but still very easy to find.
The dome it’s self was very unique and whimsical feeling. We chose a very cold night for our stay but we were plenty warm inside. It was not a simple Air BNB or hotel room, it was an experience. It may not be for everyone but it was perfect for us.
The owners have obviously put a lot of thought, time and effort into creating this destination - and from the looks of it they are continuing to make updates and improvements to the property. Great concept!

name: Francine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
The location is truly one-of-a-kind, surrounded by ancient canyons and offering panoramic views of every mountain chain in the region. Waking up to the sight of those majestic mountains is a memory I'll cherish forever.
The glamping dome itself is a work of art. It's cozy, well-equipped, and exquisitely decorated. The king bed was comfortable, temperature was perfect and tons of great artwork throughout. The champagne split was a nice touch. Whether you're a nature lover or just in need of some relaxation, this spot has it all.
The hosts provided valuable recommendations for local activities and dining, enhancing the overall experience. Their dedication to ensuring our comfort did not go unnoticed.
I can't recommend this Airbnb enough. It's the coolest spot in the Santa Fe area, and I can't wait to return for another magical stay on those 8 private acres. When they finish the deck, it will be a great outdoor space to sit and view the stars. Thank you for sharing this gem!

name: Briana
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: I could not have imagined a better experience staying at Trey’s Super Dome. Incredible views, so many amenities (especially for basically a tent), easy to follow directions for check-in and check-out. Be sure to turn out the dome lights at night and sit outside to enjoy the night sky with minimal light pollution - breathtaking. During our stay, we saw that they are currently working on building a lookout deck which seems like it’ll be an incredible new feature for future guests! The only slight misunderstanding on our part was that the house that Trey and his wife stay in is closer than expected - like in their backyard pretty much - BUT still absolutely private enough and this did not negatively affect our stay, it might just be nice to have some additional pics to set clearer expectations. I would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a unique and memorable experience in the wilderness and we look forward to maybe returning in the future if the opportunity presents itself!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: First impressions were a little rough, the tent was HOT when we arrived at 5pm and we were worried it was going to stay that way through the night but 2 hours later and it had cooled off substantially. The views are incredible, probably the most beautiful sunset I’ve ever seen. We loved sitting outside watching the sunset and looking at the stars. We even saw a star link satellite that looked like a snake of stars going across the night sky. (Pro tip bring camping chairs or buy some at target when you get there) it’s so beautiful but having a comfy place to sit outside would be amazing! The inside of the tent is cozy. Laying on the comfy couch with a wall of stars was magical, and waking up to pink cloud sunrises was my favorite part. Overall it was a great experience.

review_text: By far the most unique place we’ve stayed! I chose this place for mine and my partner’s anniversary and we absolutely loved it! We have 3 large dogs so vacationing can be difficult for us, but being able to bring our four legged family members made this trip even that much better! Trey recommend some gorgeous nearby hikes and places to explore which we really appreciated considering we weren’t familiar with the area! We got to watch a spectacular lightening show with the best possible view on our first night, hiked the Cerillos Hills State Park the next day and got to fall asleep stargazing in the comfort of the dome to end our last night’s stay. The dome itself was very clean, wouldn’t even be able to notice if any pets had stayed there in the past! It was well equipped with the essentials we needed and had a very cozy feel to it! Overall this was a really wonderful stay, and Mr. Trey and his wife are amazing hosts!

This place is truly special.

It was very cute and clean and easy to get to. Just don't go if temps are high. Trey switched out the portable a/c to try and remedy the problem and was communicative, but it just couldn't be cooled at that point.

review_text:
Really great stay! The location is remote and beautiful. We needed a place to crash on our move to CO and it was perfect! Breathtaking views and host was very responsive! Bed is super comfy and the place was clean and has everything you need!
Like the other reviews mentioned, this is definitely a glamping experience. IE remember the elements still play a factor. The dome was very hot until about 8pm, which the AC helped with a little bit but it was still very warm. But again, it’s a giant plastic Dome so that’s to be expected in July. Just know what kind of experience you a getting and adjust expectations accordingly
I give everything 5 stars except for the value we paid which I think is 4. While it’s a really great and unique stay, I did feel that the interior could be upgraded for the price we were paying. Just having nice furniture and upgraded amenities would be the cherry on top.
Perfect little get away that’s not too far but far enough! Would recommend and stay again!

review_text: Before booking I read everything about the place & looked at the pictures, I knew that we were gong to be in for an entirely different experience than ever having , so I really wanted to be open minded. I'm sorry to say the Dome was just not for us. When we got inside it was so terribly hot in there. It would have been nice for the host to have turned on the a/c before we arrived or at least reached out to us & asked if we would like it on. The pictures of the inside looked a lot prettier & cleaner than it was in person. I took my dogs & was terrified they were going to fall off the cliff/mountain anytime I had to take them out. There wasn't any place to walk with them. For the price we paid I feel like it could have been cleaner & fresh smelling. The couch was very uncomfortable & the only place outside to sit to see "the view" was a hard wood flat bench.

It’s totally protected from the elements yet still very open and airy. Once in a lifetime type of place!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Worst experience I’ve ever had. Please take lots of pictures of your stay because he takes no responsibility for his dirty location and says you’re the problem. Glad I took lots of pics and got my money back from AIRB&B because he was not going to help. Towels were stained, bugs on photos and looks like he uses the building for storage. No door on bathroom and he leaves the location hot (didn’t have AC on prior to our arrival). I think he has video camera inside because I never complained about the TV and he messaged me basically calling me an idiot for not being able to work his TV. Strong gas smell has me worried for future visitors safety and sewer smell as well. Prison down the road but he leaves the door wide open for arrival. Freaky location, poor host - do not recommend. Thank God for AirB&B customer service because Trey isn’t it. I wish him well but wow, it was not for us. See his responses on other reviewed for anyone making any recommendations. Good luck future visitors.

Stayed one night
review_text: This dome is such a cute & secluded stay with an AMAZING view! The owners were very transparent in the description which is much appreciated. Dogs are allowed at the location so be aware, there was dog hair all over the couch. My husband and I left with our blankets and clothes covered in it(it was kind of a let down to us considering the price was so high due to “cleaning fees for dogs”) but it was mentioned in the description so we weren’t too shocked. The water does smell bad BUT it was so nice to have an easily accessible toilet and a nice shower available there inside the dome. It is a perfect space for 2 people wanting a unique camp getaway. If you are boujee, this place isn’t for you. It did get hot & dusty but it was expected due to the fact that we were in a dome in the summer, it was windy, and we were located at the end of a cliff surrounded by dirt. I would 100% recommend this stay but really push to read the description as this location is not suitable for all people

My wife and I spent a night at the SuperDome on our way back home from a car trip through the southwest. Maybe one small regret was our choice to spend just the one night in Santa Fe. Situated in the back of the property, from inside the dome it is nearly impossible to see any other building, letting you feel like you have the whole desert to yourself.
Being able to curl up on the couch watching the sunset and stars come out at night will stand as one of my favorite memories of the trip. We’re seriously considering coming back and staying a little longer in the next couple years.

review_text: By far the coolest Airbnb I’ve ever stayed in! My fiancé proposed to me the night before we stayed here while we were out camping on national forest lands. After 2 days in the woods (& rainy nights) we decided to head into Santa Fe and book and Airbnb day of to celebrate surrounded by creature comforts. We had put in several requests around 2 pm to multiple spots (check in for most Airbnbs is usually 3 or 4) and no one was responding and we were exhausted. Trey was the only host who responded to my last minute request IMMEDIATELY and approved our stay, and wow, what a treat!!! The Santa Fe Super Dome is spectacular and offers unparalleled desert views and paths through gorgeous scenery. The walkway from the driveway/parking spot to the dome itself was magical (ample lighting and you’re immediately immersed in breathtaking scenery). The space inside was luxurious and as described/pictured! This made our engagement weekend more magical and romantic than we ever imagined. Thank you Trey.

Rating, 3 stars

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Was very overpriced for the lack of comfort and supplies. The dome had only two small heaters and the temperature never went above 50 degrees. It was uncomfortable sleeping because it was so cold. There was also not enough rugs so the floor in the bathroom and throughout the house was ice cold. In addition no house rules, just an old water damaged handout about some local shops to check out.
It was a unique experience, but it shouldn’t be rented out in the winter if the host cannot provide adequate heat. Also the shower was a little dirty with mostly empty toiletries. I just feel the space isn’t represented accurately online and should be marketed as as more of a camping experience than a super dome. At more than $500 a night I would expect a clean shower, full toiletries, newer towels, room temperatures above 50 degrees and up to date amenities.

review_text: We had an incredible time at the Super Dome! Such a meditative experience, looking out into the vast landscape at night from the comfort of a couch in a heated room. Sunrise is absolutely beautiful too. Amenities are all in good working condition and the shower is great. Would recommend staying here to anyone. FYI, if you visit in the winter, the stargazing window at the very top of the dome will be covered with insulation to keep the heat in -- but you'll be glad it's there, 'cause it can get veryyy cold outside! Would love to see this place again in the summer :-)

review_text:
Overall a unique experience with a beautiful view of the sandia mountains. While we enjoyed our stay, we question if the one night getaway was truly worth the cost(~500 total). Obviously that judgement is personal and will be dependent on your financial situation. In our opinion we have stayed in a number of Santa Fe airbnbs for much cheaper with similar views. However the dome itself is a unique stay in the Santa Fe area.
Other notes: The bed is very comfy (we slept great), the space is perfectly clean, the pillows are firm/thick (we brought our own thankfully), the temperature was comfortable once the sun went down (stayed in Jan 40-50 degrees outside), the kitchenette really doesn’t have much as advertised, shower is nice.

Stayed one night
review_text: As it got darker outside, the room got colder and colder. Two portable heaters and a not so efficient wall mounted heater were clearly not enough for a 10 degree night. I reached out to the host and asked politely if there’s any way we could make the room a little warmer. “No,” the host replied, “That’s what we got. You may have to put sweater on but I find it pretty comfortable”. Other than the heating problem, we also found a leftover exploded frozen Coke in the freezer, a coffee pot with rust on the bottom, a dirty oven, a watery hand soap and a watery body wash. We filed a claim to Airbnb addressing these issues. The next day, the host replied by saying “it is very clear about the fact that it can get cold” and the exploded Coke is “apparently from the guest the night before” and therefore “complimentary”. He even attacked me personally by saying “you probably yell at the front desk clerk when you stay in a hotel and probably talk down to waitresses”. Worst experience EVER.

There’s also a sound bar which makes it really atmospheric to have music playing in the dome. My only wish would be for it to be better signposted for the route from the car to the dome. The hosts were so lovely and very responsive. I’ve already had so many friends request the details!

review_text:
La Casita, a hidden gem in the heart of NM, exceeded our expectations in every way. From the moment we arrived, we knew we were in for an incredible stay. The highlight of our experience was undoubtedly the luxurious hot tub, which provided the perfect retreat after a long day of exploring.
The attention to detail throughout the property was remarkable, and the master bedroom closet was a dream come true for my wife. She couldn't help but envy the organization and spaciousness, making her wish she had one just like it back home.
Our evenings spent indulging in relaxation, cozied up next to the crackling fireplace while enjoying our favorite TV shows, were nothing short of divine. The atmosphere was so warm and inviting, creating the ultimate ambiance for a perfect getaway.
We cannot recommend La Casita enough for anyone seeking an unforgettable Airbnb experience. The combination of comfort, style, and amenities truly made our stay one for the books.

For restaurants in the area, I recommend Clafoutis for breakfast and Radish & Rye for dinner. Both were excellent.

name: Robin
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
My husband and I stayed for a week for our honeymoon, and the casita was perfect! We loved the minimal, zen feel of the casita- the walls have a beautiful, warm texture that makes you feel enveloped, and reflects light beautifully. The casita was easy to find, and just a few miles from downtown Santa Fe.
Things we loved: SUPER clean, very quiet, comfy furniture, comfy bed, no weird smells inside, extra pillows and blankets, organic toiletries for use, lots of towels, robes & sandals for use, big hot tub, large kitchen with plenty of cookware, big TV, private sun-dappled yard, blackout shade in the bedroom, GIANT closet with drawers & hangers, NO chores to do upon checkout
Things to note: Pillows are feather pillows, so they felt a bit lumpy to us. We had to buy cooking oil, and there are no spices beyond salt & pepper. Dishwasher did not do a great job, so we wound up handwashing most dishes. We had to trap a little desert mouse one night- not a big deal, but we did not realize that leaving the door open for a bit would cause critters to get in. The fireplace does work, but you just have to stand RIGHT in front and hold down the ON button for 12 seconds (we had a little issue getting it to work the first day)

The coffee closet was well stocked, complete with a grinder and a fantastic metal French press. The king size bed gives plenty of room to spare, as does the walk in closet. Most amenities work well as intended, although the dishwasher didn't clean as well as we'd hoped. Overall, this was definitely a great place to stay, and we enjoyed it very much.

Rating, 5 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The casita was a gorgeous place to stay while in Santa Fe! While it is connected to a larger portion of the owner’s home, it is completely private. We actually never saw anybody outside the house. The place itself was perfectly clean without a spec of dust anywhere. (Yes, I’m on of those people who look around for it). If the casita wasn’t already great enough, the added finishing touches made it extra luxurious. Every detail was considered down to multiple coffee makers of varying types, to robes and slip on shoes for the hot tub. The bed and linens were soft and cozy and I slept like a baby!
My only complaint is that Uber drivers had difficulty knowing which driveway to enter. This by no means takes away from the perfection of the casita. I would stay here again and definitely recommend to others!

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I unfortunately had to cancel my trip to NM due to wildfires in the surrounding areas of Santa Fe. Just wanted to share a word of caution that Cristiana & Mavrick are very strict in implementing their cancellation policy. I didn't realize quite how bad the wildfires were until slightly after the deadline to cancel with a 50% refund. When I reached out to the hosts, they were firm in not granting me any refund at all, even in the event that someone else rebooked my cancelled dates. In any case, I hope everyone stays safe and exercises caution in these difficult situations!

We loved the customized screen doors that allowed for air flow with screening and a really cool, very unique latch and lock system. Parking was ample and the plants all around had been lovingly cared for. Steve especially enjoyed the lilacs that were in the midst of blooming.
Just a stellar place! We loved it.

review_text:
We had a lovely time at Sarah and Luke's peaceful casita. The place is well laid out, with charming New Mexican decor, and was a quiet sanctuary after spending the day out on the town or having adventures abroad. The coffee and herbal tea (from their garden) were lovely touches.
The kitchen had everything we needed to cook full meals at home when we weren't dining out.
Tune Up cafe is walkable and delicious. La Montañita co-op is also walkable down the river path if you don't mind a few more steps. Downtown and the Plaza are a quick drive, 5-8 mins depending on traffic.
Communication was great. Would definitely recommend and we would love to stay here again in the future!

The casita itself is pristine and has great aesthetics, the bed is very comfy, there are simple but thoughtful supplies and amenities … a great place for a restful stay.

I honestly wish we had more time to go around Santa Fe using Barbara’s guest home as our base but we were just traveling through. Her directions were perfect; it was an easy drive up from the main roads. We walked around the property on the trail this morning and that was a lovely way to stretch our legs. The beds were super comfortable and clean and I personally love that they are next to each other so I could keep my kids close. The water is HOT and the shower and bathroom were also spotless; one of the best stays we’ve ever had :)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: I didn't have a ton of contact with Barbara, but she was v kind and communicative. The guest suite was spotless, cozy and welcoming. Bed was comfortable, and I appreciated that the two beds seemed to be slightly different firmness to choose from (I'd say in medium-firm range.). Kitchenette was nice for warming up food, making tea and refrigerating/freezing some basics. Also nice to have the work desk. Good closet for storage. Neighborhood in the hills was lovely and quiet, and stars at night were pretty. Location felt central but tucked away, a short drive to plaza, museum hill, etc. Shower was good and bathroom super clean and spacious + plush towels. The easy walk/hike nearby in Arroyo Hondo open space (right before bridge) was great. Wifi was decent and fine for work (didn't have meetings, so not sure how it holds up for video calls, but I think it would be okay). Driveway to suite was a bit icy/snowy, but my FWD SUV didn't have any problems and driveway is flat. I'd def stay again!

review_text:
Barbara's place is beautiful, extremely comfortable, and spacious! We enjoyed a late dinner on the shared porch -- very nice! Everything was spotless. Although it feels like your'e out in the country, it is actually close to the Plaza. We would highly recommend Barbara's place!
There is a discrepancy in the listed amenities. The description of the space accurately states that there is a kitchenette. However, under kitchen amenities, the kitchen is described as space where guests can cook their own meals. That is not accurate. I'm sure that can be easily corrected on the web site.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Turquoise Skies is one of those places you'd like to keep quiet about, lest it be discovered and not readily available! However, that would not be fair to Barbara or other travelers. I was attending a conference downtown, but craved a quiet retreat for my evenings. I was thrilled to find, within just a few minutes' drive of historic city square, a sanctuary of beauty and a place of peace. I found it to be exactly as described, with one tiny exception. When I booked it months before my visit, the amenities listed on Airbnb included a kitchen, which isn't accurate. The suite does include a well-stocked cabinet with a small fridge/freezer, coffee pot, toaster, microwave, and every little thing you can imagine for keeping things cool and warming things up. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate mix, paper goods, plastic flatware are provided. There is an easy-to-use gas grill in the lovely courtyard. But this little suite is inviting, comfortable, immaculately clean, and charming. Thanks, Barbara!

This is one of the best air bnb's I've ever had the pleasure to stay in!! We cannot wait to come back. It felt extremely private, was perfect for our dog, quiet and peaceful, walkable to town and so clean and beautiful.
Liz was extremely responsive (not that we needed anything, everything was already perfect!) but left us alone as well so we felt like we had full privacy.
Make sure to eat at the Tune Up Cafe in the neighborhood, it was a gem.
We loved our weekend in Santa Fe, hiking, food and shops etc..but this air bnb was the best part...truly!! If you're trying to decide whether or not to book it, just do it!!

Our dog lounged all day in the backyard that reminded us of Costa Rica while we read books with the French doors open. It perfectly encapsulates the vibe of Santa Fe. Great location, clean and safe, too. 10/10 reccomend!

The casita is super clean, comfortable, has cool artwork, lots of natural light, and the private yard was the perfect place to enjoy the beautiful spring weather. Great location in a quiet neighborhood and super close to restaurants and things to do. Liz and her family were super friendly, accommodating, and were quick to respond to questions and provided easy instructions and information for check-in and out. Highly recommend!!

review_text: We loved our stay at Liz’s place! The space was clean and beautiful - and we especially liked being able to open up the french doors and “bring the outside in”! We were lucky to be there when the lilacs were blooming and they smelled wonderful! The location is fantastic - an easy walk to the rail yard for the farmers and artisans markets, and it was close to great restaurants (listed in her comprehensive area guide). We also walked to the plaza and canyon road, but those are a little farther. We would happily stay at liz’s place next time we’re in Santa Fe!

Highly recommend and would gladly stay here again.

We had a wonderful stay at Liz's casita. We would call it New Mexico True. The neighborhood was quiet. The greeting by Scott when we arrived was very nice and Liz was very accommodating and communicative when we had a question.
The location is exceptional for the price paid since Santa Fe is a high priced area. We were able to get to Santa Fe Plaza in just a five minute drive and to all other areas around the city with ease, especially to our favorite restaurants.
The Casita was decorated in a true New Mexico style, which we enjoyed and the private yard was great for our little yorkie. She loved that yard as much as we did.
We would definitely stay here again.

Susan's Fine Wine & Spirits is close enough to walk to if you're a walker and they are top notch! Great selection of wine if you are a wine nerd. Ask for Brian and you will be taken care of.
I would stay here again.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
My family of 4 stayed here on our way to California for a move and Liz's place was exactly what we needed! It was so welcoming and they thought of everything. From little notes on how things work to the bottle of wine on the counter as we entered made us feel like we were staying at our families house. They also provided paper towels, toilet paper, laundry detergent and coffee and tea. Sometimes AirB&B's can be difficult because you have to go out and buy the essentials or pack it and having everything there for us on this move was amazing and comforting. This place completely surpassed our expectations!
Just for others to know...there is not central air (normal for Santa Fe). We stayed at the end of July during a heat wave and the bedroom was very hot even at night. I think typically it doesn't get that hot so it wouldn't have been an issue and there was a window AC in the living room so that did help with some heat. We would still stay here again in the future and loved it!

review_text: Lovely, cozy, private casita (on the same lot as the owner's house and another studio, but it doesn't share the wall and has its own fenced backyard and patio with chairs and table; it also has its own parking spot right outside the gate) with cute decor. Liz was very responsive and a great communicator. Her attention to detail was superb. Everything was in the casita, including the washer/dryer and detergent, and plenty of towels. Liz left a bottle of wine we didn't drink, and some fruit and snacks. The location was great, near Sprouts, Whole Food, and Trader Joe's. It was within minutes of many restaurants and just a little over a mile from the Plaza. I agree with other reviews that the parking could be awkward. Arriving there before sunset would help with locating the casita and navigating the parking. The floor heating was a plus during the winter months. We would definitely stay here again the next time we are in Santa Fe.

review_text: We were blown away by Liz's place! Absolutely gorgeous and beautifully decorated. She kindly left a bottle of wine, water, and a variety of snacks. We met a wonderful lady and her dog who was staying for a month at an adjoining property of Liz's. Turns out that among other great things about Santa Fe, it is dog friendly, as is Liz's property. If you do bring your dog, definitely check out Frank Ortiz Dog Park, an amazing dog park consisting of 138 acres of arroyos, hills, and trails. It is only 5 minutes by car from Liz's. The property is in a great location - close to not only the dog park, but other areas of interest as well as restaurants and stores. Liz is a fantastic communicator and she really reflects the kindness and friendliness that are characteristics of so many people in Santa Fe.

review_text: Location, location, location! An easy walk to downtown and a shorter walk to the Railyard would be enough to leave a good review. We brought our dog and there was enough room for us to set up two dog beds (yes, he's spoiled). We all enjoyed lounging on the patio, and lucky for us, the apricot tree was ready to be picked. The place was so cute, cozy, and welcoming. It was also well furnished, had heated floors that warmed both the floors and unit itself, good amenities, clean, as well as details here and there that the host took to ensure a pleasant visit.
Great location that was quiet and felt safe. Within walking distance from Tune-Up Café (highly recommend!). Near a number of different grocery store options and points of interest.

It is very private and relaxing with a nice patio. We would highly recommend the Casita for a stay in Santa Fe and would stay here again.

The kitchen had everything we needed, the bedroom was thoughtfully arranged. Power near the nightstands a plus!
Loved having a fire every night. Sunlight throughout the day thanks to small skylights.
Neighborhood is quiet.
It was easy to see they wanted this to be a home and it felt like it.
Only heads up- the mattress is quite firm which could work great if you’re a back sleeper. The wifi is not robust enough to support remote office work as some are choosing to not go back to an office so you would need a private hotspot.

Although it is technically a guest house, you have full privacy and your own back yard. Loved waking up in the morning with the opened French doors leading to the backyard.
Liz was a wonderful host- super responsive and accommodating. We were even welcomed with our own bottle of wine, which was a great touch after a long car ride. Thank you again and we will be back soon!

I rented a car in order to drive to a number of hiking trails (there's a wonderful abundance of them!), but I also walked to the downtown area. The quiet studio was a great place to gets some work done and to retreat when I was tired from being out and about.
Highly recommend! Thanks, Gudrun.

I travel without a car and was able to do everything on foot in Santa Fe or by (free!) public transport to explore the surrounding area and go hiking. Gudrun was very responsive and welcoming. I thought it was cool to have a ladder up to the bed, but I know not everyone wants to have that climb, so consider that before booking.
All in all, I had a great stay here and would certainly come again.

review_text: First, Gudrun was an amazing host and a very kind and helpful person. I texted my friend about an hour after I arrived to say, "There's a lady who owns the Airbnb I am staying at and I want to be her when I am older." Next, the location was perfect. I was there a Tuesday through Sunday and I used my car only one time to drive to a trailhead. It is in walking distance to downtown and the Railyard and it is nice to have all of that variety in walking distance to explore. There are amazing restaurants and a grocery close by. The space itself was also really great and importantly, very quiet and peaceful. Totally quiet for sleeping which is rare in my experience. The space has all the basics and I cannot think of anything that I wished it had. I have been going to Santa Fe for 20 years and have stayed in all sorts of accommodations and I truly hope I have the opportunity to stay at Gudrun's place again!

The kitchen is stocked so I could easily make coffee, a meal and I loved that she provided me with a variety of tea (avid tea drinker) It is walking distance to the supermarkets and great cafes. The bathroom provided good basic amenities even though I brought my own. I stayed here for a week and felt right at home, the Airbnb provided me with privacy and security. I loved the big window upstairs which gave excellent natural lighting and a view of the beautiful night sky. I would recommend to stay at Gudrun’s if youre planning a solo trip in Santa Fe. Thank you so much for having me Gudrun!

review_text:
Gudrun's space is a perfectly cozy place for a short term or longer stay. It is clear Gudrun has considered all away from home scenerios and has provided her guests with everything you could need.
I had the worse thing happen while travelling this summer; I came down with a bad case of covid. Gudrun jumped into action and provided me with a test kit and then followed up with the local clinic to make sure that I would be seen there. As I was suffering with the symptoms, she never let me feel like she was in fear of the virus or that I was an inconvenience by staying there. She helped me recover with her distant and constant care.
Eventually I was able to travel home on my scheduled dates and thank Gudrun very much for her thoughtfulness and excellent hosting.

The ladder was strong and I didn't have any issues getting up and down from the loft. It was a few degrees warmer in the loft but it was also very hot in Santa Fe the first few days. I loved staying here and hope to come back again next year.

Next, not only it is walking distance to the plaza - it is also walking distance to the rail yard district which also has cool restaurants and bars (and where to catch the train to Albuquerque). The airport shuttle from Albuquerque drops off five minutes from Gudrun’s house. Spent four days without a car and didn’t miss it at all!
Finally, Gudrun was incredibly nice! I needed to change my dates slightly to accommodate a flight change and Gudrun was very helpful!
In sun - I worked remotely there, relaxed there, and explored Santa Fe from there - and all was great!

Overall though, it's cozy and functional; I would recommend it, especially (as the host notes) for a single person.

Gudrun is an absolutely lovely host -- friendly, interesting, a good communicator, and readily available should you need anything. Highly recommended!

name: Bonnie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: I was fortunate enough to get to spend a week at this relaxing retreat. It was extremely comfortable to the point where I set out later than I intended most mornings, after I brewed my coffee and enjoyed it out at the bistro table in my private, fenced, shaded little flagstone patio area. I slept well up in the sleeping loft, enjoying the cool morning cross breeze coming in the loft window for a few minutes before getting up each day, and the very faint sound of church bells in the distance. The yoga mat in the closet was perfect for doing sun salutations. Most mornings I would set out for a walk then, and I was ecstatic to find that there were so many great restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. I walked to the Plaza 2 or 3 times most days, walked to the delicious French restaurant, and walked to various grocery stores to pick up staples for preparing simple meals back in the studio's kitchen. The dishes, pots and pans, 2-burner cooktop, and refrigerator were everything I needed for cooking and eating in. The studio felt very safe and is in a quiet neighborhood with friendly neighbors. I found Gudrun, the host, to be very sweet and helpful in giving tips for an amazing Santa Fe experience. Her restaurant recommendations were spot on and very much appreciated. The studio itself was nicely decorated with artwork and southwestern style furnishings, and was such a peaceful and pleasant place to spend time reading and relaxing. I would 100% love to stay here again on return trips, it was such a fantastic and rejuvenating stay.

review_text: I loved my stay at Gudrun’s place! It is a 20 minutes or less walk from everything that you would need—in one direction, the plaza and historic/tourist center, and in the other direction, Trader Joe’s, Whole Foods, taco trucks and more. The loft bed is adorable and made me feel like I was having a sleepover. Parking was easy on the street, and the place was immaculately clean. I’d definitely stay here again!

I am almost 60-years-old and climbed with no problem.

Gudrun was an exceptional host, and went out of her way to make sure my stay was as comfortable as possible. I can't thank her enough for making Santa Fe feel like a home away from home!

The natural light that comes in through the sleeping loft windows is lovely and the mini kitchen had everything I could have wanted (and in pristine condition). It was a great place to set up my remote work space for a couple of days as well. Gudrun has done a great job with this place, and Gudrun herself was very helpful and responsive. I highly recommend this stay, and wish I could have stayed longer!

If you are someone who needs a substantial mattress to sleep comfortably, do know that this mattress is only a few inches, and placed on the floor of the loft. It was not a problem for me, but could be for others. Gudrun was kind and communicative, and I appreciate her hospitality very much :)

There is a small kitchen with a small fridge and a two burner stove for making simple meals, I typically ate my breakfast on the small patio outdoors in the morning. Gudrun was a fantastic and communicative host, she left me a lot of tips for nearby restaurants, almost all of which had patio seating for Covid times. Her house is nestled in a charming neighborhood, a 15 minute walk from downtown Santa Fe and a 5-10min walk from lots of great restaurants. If I came back, I would hope her place is available to stay again. Enjoy!

review_text: Perfect location and an amazing host for my two-week stay, whereby I spent much-needed time alone to read and write. Gudrun was so responsive and gracious at all times. She met me upon my arrival at her home, and we occasionally chatted during the 14 days I stayed in her lovely studio located next door. I was completely comfortable during the Santa Fe hot spell thanks to a large overhead fan (I never needed the smaller fan adjacent to the loft bed) and the instructions she left about opening up windows in the evening. I lived in Santa Fe many years ago and do visit often, but the reminder was helpful. I didn't rent a car as her place is in walking distance to the best parts of Santa Fe. It's easy enough to rent a car for those day trips or hiking out of the area. I highly recommend this lovely spot, and know others will appreciate Gudrun's intelligence, helpfulness and hospitality as much as I did!

I had a car but you don’t really need one unless you’re going to leave the central Santa Fe area.
Simply put: I LOVED my stay here and look forward to coming back.

She is located close to cafes for breakfast (she provides a list) and within walking distance of the historic plaza close to shopping and lots of shops. Thank you Gudrun!

The bed is up a sturdy ladder in a loft, which could be tough if you have bad knees or dislike heights, but if the ladder's not a problem it gives a fun feeling of staying in a pueblo. Highly recommend.

The loft bed was cozy and comfortable, the space was quiet and peaceful, and it was perfect for both doing work in the morning and relaxing after long days. Gudrun was very welcoming and kind! I have to say that of the many AirBnb places I've stayed at over the years, this one might be my favorite!

review_text: Gudrun was a lovely host and was quick to respond to my messages. When I arrived, she gave me great tips on restaurants, museums and public transport in Santa Fe. The studio is located in a quiet neighbourhood with a large supermarket and a few eating places within walking distance, and is about a 15-minute walk from the central plaza area. The apartment was comfortable and is perfect for a single traveller or couple. The bed is located in a loft that is easy to get to using a short ladder, but take note if going up a ladder will be a problem for you. The studio was clean and warm – there were 2 space heaters in the room but one was enough to keep the room comfortable when I visited in winter in February. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at this studio apartment and would stay here again if I made another trip to Santa Fe.

It includes a small kitchenette (two burners, sink, small counter space, and a small fridge perfect for short stays but no oven) and a wonderful sleeping loft that is accessible only by ladder. There's a nice amount of natural light, a comfy couch, a large closet, and a small and peaceful outdoor area. I would definitely stay here again.

The quarter is very quiet and typical, with beautiful adobe houses, trees. My stay was a dream. Thank You Gudrun !

The casita is a quick walk to the Plaza, many restaurants, the Gruet tasting room (a must-try for lovers of bubbly), and so much more. Her place was clean, well-stocked, and comfortable — and Gundrun herself is lovely. Please stay here — you won’t be disappointed! ❤️

name: Theodore
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2018
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: I had a wonderful 8 day stay at Gudrun's place. The studio is a separate unit adjacent to the main house which is completely self contained and includes a small private fenced patio area and a private entrance. The studio itself is very distinctive and has a definite Santa Fe feel to it. The sleeping area is a loft that you access via a small ladder - the main floor includes a dining/living area, kitchen, and a large closet. The studio is clean and airy and has a nice feeling to it. I was attending a conference downtown (at the Community Convention Center) and was able to walk there in about 15-20 minutes. Walking to the main tourist areas downtown would probably be the same or slightly less. There is a Whole Foods Market within about 10 minutes of the studio, along with several nice restaurants. Gudrun provided a list of nearby restaurants which was especially helpful upon arrival. I very much enjoyed my stay and would certainly stay here again whenever I return to Santa Fe.

name: Diane
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2017
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Gudrun was a wonderful and accommodating host. Not only did she provide me with resources prior to arriving at her home from the airport, but she even offered to pick me up at a shuttle stop nearby. The studio was perfect for one person and the kitchen was fully stocked with everything I needed. The loft with the ladder gave a nostalgic feel and was reminiscent of my childhood where I would fight over who had the top bunk, but this time, no fighting needed! The high ceiling was also a plus as there was a row of windows placed across the top of the side of one wall that let in the warmth and light during the day and then during the night, while laying on the bed, you can see the moon and some stars. Simply beautiful.
Location was ideal and it was about a good 15 minute walk to downtown and a 5 minute walk to the farmer’s market/Railyard. If you don’t want to do the 15 minute walk, then there’s a free shuttle that will take you throughout downtown (plus Canyon Road and Museum Hill) and the nearest free shuttle stop to the studio is across from the State Capitol building — only a five minute walk from the studio.
Between the free shuttle and public transit, you can practically go anywhere without renting a car. Though, I do suggest Uber/Lyft if you plan to travel at night.
All in all, definitely recommend this studio if you’re looking for quaint, cozy and accessibility.

This was my first airbnb experience and it couldn't have been a better introduction. The studio was charming, very clean and included a kitchen stocked with everything you would need to prepare meals.
While I expected a comfortable space, what I didn't expect was the attentiveness of the host. Gudrun was generous in spirit and in action. For example, she volunteered to drive me to the hotel when I was running late for a conference and to the shuttle when I was leaving. The bonus was that she shared her adorable dogs upon request! You can't get that in an over-priced hotel!
While Gudrun was attentive, she was not intrusive in any way, I had as much privacy as I wanted/needed. I really cannot say enough good things about Gudrun and her airbnb!

review_text: I had a great time in Santa Fe while staying in Gudrun's studio. The decoration in the studio charming and very consistent with Santa Fe and southwestern colors. I was a little wary of having to climb a ladder to get to the bed, but the climb isn't that bad, and I actually enjoyed being high up and being able to hear the rain on the roof. Gudrun was very attentive and actually drove me to Museum Hill one day when it was pouring rain. Museum Hill turned out to be one of my favorite spots. The studio is about a 10-15 minute walk from downtown. My one caution would be that the street/neighborhood where the studio is located is not well lit at night. If you want to go out after dark, it's probably best to take a Lyft/Uber, which can feel a little ridiculous if you're going a short distance. Though the studio is close to downtown, you will have to cross some rather busy streets to get to downtown. All in all, the studio is a great value, and I enjoyed my time there. I highly recommend it.

rating_info:

June 2017
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
When the airport shuttle dropped me off in front of Gudrun's adobe home after a ride through picturesque Santa Fe residential neighborhoods, my fellow van riders seemed jealous and I was secretly happy. Gudrun had started communicating with me 2 weeks before my arrival to make sure everything was ready when I arrived and to be able to welcome me. She came right out to greet me, and helped me get settled into the studio.
Throughout my one week stay, I got to walk through the neighborhood, as I made my way to my conference hotel, grocery store, restaurants and pharmacy. All within comfortable and safe walking distance. The Plaza is a little far, but doable on foot. I also noticed buses nearby. Public transportation is something I would have explored if I had stayed longer. I liked that the neighborhood was quiet.
The title of the listing says it: "cozy". The place is not big, but you definitely get more than you would staying in a hotel room. It is artfully and professionally outfitted to be welcoming and convenient. The space is so well designed and the attention to detail so great that it takes less than a day to feel right at home. Everything is in its place with an obvious purpose. Being from Switzerland originally, where space comes at a premium but people love their comfort, I noticed that about the place and absolutely loved it.
I would have loved to stay longer and next time I come to Santa Fe, I will check on lodging early and look for Gudrun's cozy studio.

name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this charming Casita in the heart of the Santa Fe hills. The home is just as beautiful as pictured - light-filled rooms with comfortable furnishings, artwork, and stylish decor. Everything was spotless and comfortable. The location is phenomenal - just steps outside Santa Fe's stunning mountains.
Charles was very welcoming and made sure I had everything I needed, including recommendations for local spots. The self check-in process was smooth and hassle-free. The Casita itself is thoughtfully equipped with all the essentials and the wifi worked great. The bedroom was quiet and peaceful with beautiful views. The living room was a perfect spot to relax after a day exploring the city.
I would absolutely recommend this Casita especially for those looking to experience all that Santa Fe has to offer. It's a fantastic value in a perfect location with a wonderful host. Ideal for a couple's weekend!

review_text:
Even more charming in person, this mountain casita was perfectly clean and had everything we needed for a peaceful and relaxing stay. Sitting out on the deck with panoramic views, blue jays and even horses at the adjacent ranch was incredibly tranquil and it felt like a private paradise.
Charles is a wonderful host and made sure we had everything we needed for a great stay. We enjoyed being close to both hiking trails and downtown Santa Fe. I would absolutely recommend this spot and hope to visit again soon!

review_text: We really loved staying here! They bed was super warm and cozy, the bathroom in the house was nice, and everything was clean. We made breakfast in the trailer and enjoyed eating in the garden. Washing dishes is a bit like when camping. We had minor difficulty finding the place initially because it was very dark when we arrived after a very long drive. The trailer is super close to downtown, ~7 min. Juliet is very responsive and friendly and was a great host! Overall we really enjoyed it here and would visit again. If you are comfortable staying in a smaller space and looking for a unique experience, this is the place for you!

name: William
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay at Juliet's was everything we'd expected and more from a few nights in revamped van. the van itself was spacious and very well furnished, with a gas stove, oven, and dishwasher, and the bed was super comfortable and not cramped at all.
Juliet was very kind and welcoming, promptly answered our questions, and left very clear instructions for our check-in and check-out. Overall as kind a host as one could wish for!
If I had to mention a single minor downside to our stay, it would be that the van can get a bit chilly in the winter months (we went in January), but Juliet had it prepped with comfy slippers and a heater by the time we arrived. after cooking a quick dinner on the gas stove and letting the heater and electric blanket do their thing, we went to sleep without issue!
if you don't mind stepping out of your comfort zone just a bit, a stay at Juliet's van is a fantastic lodging option well worth considering! We have it marked as our #1 option for our next Santa Fe trip!

Overall, an amazing stay. I will absolutely be staying here again next time I come through Santa Fe.

Juliet is a great host! The van was way more than I expected. As a 6’4” guy I was expecting to be really cramped, but I had no issues sleeping and feeling comfortable around the cabin.
The neighborhood was great, Tune Up cafe was my spot for breakfast and dinner and the neighborhood is situated close to down town if you want to check that out.
Apricots were in season when I arrive. Juliet and her husband have a tree and we picked them together. They were absolutely delicious.
Generous, kind and fun hosts. A great, affordable pad. Great proximity to the city and easy commute for bikes. 10/10 would recommend for the solo travelers or couples shorter than 6’4”

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This Airbnb was so cozy. If sleeping in a van can be luxury, this is it. The bed was comfortable, it was clean and inviting. The nights were chilly but they provide a space heater and a heated blanket. At no point was I cold unless I was scurrying to the bathroom in the middle of the night. You can walk to pretty much anywhere from the property. The backyard space outside the van is really cool. If you’re looking to get away to Santa Fe and experience something different, Juliet and Shane are great hosts. They were both so friendly and made me feel so welcome.

name: Cindy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Juliette was a kind and gracious host. She gave us loads of recommendations that were helpful for us to experience great parts of Santa Fe including arts areas, restaurants and hiking suggestions. She was very responsive and generous.
Some reviewed mentioned that you would not need a car but I would recommend renting a car even from this location. You can definitely walk to many parts of Santa Fe from there but a car would give you more flexibility to go farther and do more things.
As for the van, it was fun to sleep so separately and privately but like some others have noted, this is not a luxury experience. You will have to climb up into the bed which will be fine for most people. It was cold when entering the van at first but we did travel in January partially to escape a seemingly endless gray frigid Chicago!
Juliette and her partner are developing the garden area around the van which should look spectacular in the summer!
Overall, we loved our stay!

Safe and quiet place to sleep after a long day of exploring.

name: Stephanie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: I had a wonderful time at Juliet's Airbnb. This is the first van I've stayed in, and they did a wonderful job with converting it to a cozy temporary home perfect for a solo traveler. The bed was comfy and the kitchenette was just what I needed. There are plenty of blankets and a space heater to keep you warm at night, and easy access to an indoor bathroom and a relaxing backyard to get some fresh air. Juliet was very responsive, sent me a tour guide of her recommendations, and even let me rent a bicycle from her, which made my Santa Fe experience even more memorable. Shane (sp) was also really helpful in getting me keys, fitting the bicycle, and answering any questions I had while I was there. They're in a great location, and even without a car I was able to get around to where I needed to go. Thanks again for hosting!

name: Jessica
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was a cute spot to stay, I loved getting a look into the van experience and the backyard was beautiful. The bathroom is in the back of the main house and was accessible at all times. The van's outside lights flashed all night and made it a bit hard to sleep, but Juliet was responsive and tried hard to fix the issue (I'm assuming they've fixed it now). Overall I had a decent stay.

name: Jo
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: The van accommodated us for one night and it had a small cooking top, a small countertop water dispenser, a mini-fridge, very few dishes and cooking wares. The van is located in the backyard of the house. There was a fireplace and beautiful wooden benches to chill. There was a dry sauna outside and we didn't get a chance to use. The bathroom is in the house and is accessible at all times. Juliet had set up towels, shampoo/conditioner and soap for us to use. Juliet responded back to us within the hour or less and was available when needed. The only one minor thing was the length of the bed which doesn't work for two people with long legs. :-) Other than that, we were happy. Thanks Juliet!
